item.title: Blog with R and Hugo
item.description: Hugo is the great tool to build static web sites, i.e. sites with no backend database, just a plain HTML that is generated from a markup code. Such the site can be hosted on multiple platforms including Amazon and GitHub. The blog can be managed directly from RStudio. item.title: Rmarkdown nightmares (updated)
item.description: Setup Show whitespaces It would be clever to check the option “Options->Code->Display->Show whitespace characters” in RStudio. Otherwise you will never know how many whitespaces you put at the end of a line, and then you may spend a lot of time figuring errors in paragraphs formatting. The rule of two spaces to end a paragraph is not the best feature of the markup language. UTF8 If you use languages other than English to write your posts, do not forget to check “Options->Code->Saving->Default” to set text encoding to UTF8, otherwise knitr will produce gibberish.
